problem_text:
A group is called pro-orderable if every partial ordering of the group extends
to a linear ordering.
a) Is the wreath product of two arbitrary pro-orderable groups again pro-orderable?
b) (A. I. Mal’cev). Is every subgroup of a pro-orderable group again pro-orderable?
M. I. Kargapolov
answer:
Not always, in both cases (V. M. Kopytov, Algebra i Logika, 5, no. 6 (1966), 27–31
(Russian)).
